About Me

BIO

Hi there, thanks for taking the time to learn a little bit about me. I am a motivated web developer with over two years of professional experience. I am coder by day, and an artist and father by night. I enjoy taking on complex challenges, and turning them into clean, simple and understandable user experiences. I take pride in the work that I do, and enjoy learning about the different business I create sollutions for. Please take the time to explore some of the projects I've worked on.


Global Rainbow

Laser Technician

The Global Rainbow is an incredible and emotional international art intallation made designed and curated by international visual artist Yvette Matterm. The installation is made from seven highly collimated, low divergence, powerful laser beams. There is identical power in each wavelength band, creating a natural, and beautiful rainbow. I am responsibile for the successful technical execution of each job. By installing requisite hardware to service the installation, running the software to calibrate each laser, and maintainimg legacy code, I have succesfully run shows in five countries.

July 2018 – Present

Francis Solar

Project Manager

I managed a large-scale residential solar operation in Austin, Tx. I trained new employees, managed installation crews, coordinated timelines and kept our crew engaged, productive and in high spirits. The technical aspects of the jobs were exciting. I programmed all inverters onsite, ensured elecrical installation was up to company standards, coordinated with local electrical inspector, troubleshot all technical issues, documented each step of installation on the cloud, scheduled work flow, and communicated with finance, accounting, and sales to ensure company wide collaboration.

June 2017 – May 2018

Shades of Brown

Managing Barista

Working as a barista has been one of the great joys of my professional life. I have learned so many valuable lessons, and gained many lasting friendships through my years working as a barista. Talking with people from all walks of life has led me to appreciate and respect others in more meaningful ways. As a barista, you are trained to modulate your own emotions. I learned to maintain composure, even in the most chaotic moments, to leverage my personality to help others feel welcome, and how to make the best cup of coffee ever. A skill that I celebrate every morning.

January 2014 - July 2016 || August 2018 - March 2020
